00001 /**
00002  * @file        bbssp.c
00003  * @brief       Bottleneck Biconnected Spanning Subgraph solver.
00004  *
00005  * Solves the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem (BBSSP) problem
00006  * on the given input files.
00007  *
00008  * @author      John LaRusic
00009  */
00010 #include "arrow.h"
00011 #include <getopt.h>
00012 
00013 /**
00014  *      @brief  Entry point to program.
00015  */
00016 int main(int argc, char *argv[]);
00017 
00018 /**
00019  *      @brief  Prints usage/help message.
00020  *  @param      program_name [in] name of program
00021  */
00022 void print_help(char *program_name);
00023 
00024 /**
00025  *      @brief  Prints version message.
00026  *  @param      program_name [in] name of program
00027  */
00028 void print_version(char *program_name);
00029 
00030 /**
00031  *      @brief  Prints usage message.
00032  *      @param  program_name [in] name of program
00033  */
00034 void print_usage(char *program_name);
00035 
00036 /**
00037  *      @brief Short argument options to getopt 
00038  */
00039 static char *short_options = "hV";
00040 
00041 /**
00042  *      @brief Long argument options to getopt 
00043  */
00044 static struct option long_options[] =
00045 {
00046         {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00047         {"version", no_argument, 0, 'V'}
00048 };
00049 
00050 
00051 
00052 /****************************************************************************
00053  * Function implemenations
00054  ****************************************************************************/
00055 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00056 {       
00057         char opt;
00058         int opt_idx;
00059         
00060         /* Read options */
00061         while(1)
00062         {
00063                 opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, &opt_idx);
00064                 if(opt == -1) break;
00065                 
00066                 switch (opt)
00067                 {
00068                         case 'h':
00069                                 print_help(argv[0]);
00070                                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00071                                 break;
00072                         case 'V':
00073                                 print_version(argv[0]);
00074                                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00075                                 break;
00076                         default:
00077                                 print_usage(argv[0]);
00078                                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00079                 }
00080         }
00081         
00082         /* Read arguments */
00083         if(optind == argc)
00084         {
00085                 fprintf(stderr, "bbssp: No problem files specified.\n");
00086                 print_usage(argv[0]);
00087                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00088         }
00089         while(optind < argc)
00090         {
00091                 printf("file: %s\n", argv[optind]);
00092                 optind++;
00093         }
00094         
00095         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00096 }
00097 
00098 void print_help(char *program_name)
00099 {
00100         print_usage(program_name);
00101         printf("\n");
00102         printf("Runs the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem on\n");
00103         printf("the given TSPLIB file.\n");
00104         printf("\n");
00105         printf("Options:\n");
00106         printf("  -h, --help                print this help, then exit\n");
00107         printf("  -V, --version             print version number, then exit\n");
00108         printf("\n");
00109         printf("Report bugs to <johnlr@gmail.com>.\n");
00110 }
00111

00121         printf("There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n");
00122         printf("\n");
00123         printf("Written by John LaRusic.\n");
00124 }
00125 
00126 void print_usage(char *program_name)
00127 {
00128         printf("Usage: %s [options] file1 file2...\n", program_name);
